title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor and I try to open it in another editor in the Java Perspective by right-clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With.. System Editor', nothing happens. There is no warning or error message displayed.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, if I try to open it in another editor, I should see a warning message stating that I may overwrite changes and asking if I want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed indicating that I need to close all files first.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Close any open files.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a Java file by double-clicking on it.
4. Right-click on the Java file.
5. Select 'Open With.. System Editor' from the context menu.
Expect: A warning message or error message should appear.
